definition:
A problem $\pi\in\mathcal{NP}$ is $\mathcal{NP}$ ** if for any
$\pi^\prime\in\mathcal{NP}$ there is a Cook reduction of $\pi^\prime$ to
$\pi$. Hence if $\pi\in\mathcal{P}$ then every $\mathcal{NP}$ problem
would be in $\mathcal{P}$. A slightly stronger definition requires a
Karp reduction or Karp reduction of corresponding decision problems as
appropriate.

A search problem $R$ is *$\mathcal{NP}$ hard* if for any
$R^\prime\in\mathcal{NP}$ there is a Levin reduction of $R^\prime$ to
$R$.
